text: The course of true love never did run smooth.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast.
author: Bible (1 Corinthians)

text: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
author: Folk wisdom

text: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Grow old along with me! The best is yet to be.
author: Robert Browning

text: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
author: Aristotle

text: A successful marriage requires falling in love many times, always with the same person.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Where there is love there is life.
author: Folk wisdom

text: The greatest happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved.
author: Victor Hugo

text: Love is the only sane and satisfactory answer to the problem of human existence.
author: Folk wisdom

text: To get the full value of joy you must have someone to divide it with.
author: Mark Twain

text: The heart has its reasons which reason knows not.
author: Blaise Pascal

text: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Love is friendship set on fire.
author: Jeremy Taylor

text: One word frees us of all the weight and pain of life: that word is love.
author: Sophocles

text: A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Let the first act of every morning be to make a resolve to be happy.
author: William Ellery Channing

text: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Buddha

text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
author: Buddha

text: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Get busy living or get busy dying.
author: Folk wisdom

text: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.
author: Folk wisdom

text: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
author: Helen Keller

text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

text: Turn your face to the sun and the shadows fall behind you.
author: Maori proverb

text: Every day may not be good, but there is something good in every day.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Write it on your heart that every day is the best day in the year.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The morning hour has gold in its mouth.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy and wise.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Lost time is never found again.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Never put off till tomorrow what you can do today.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Order is the shape upon which beauty depends.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Have nothing in your house that you do not know to be useful or believe to be beautiful.
author: William Morris

text: The home should be the treasure chest of living.
author: Folk wisdom

text: A house is made of walls and beams; a home is built with love and dreams.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Peace is the beauty of life.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
author: Aristotle

text: Nothing is impossible to a willing heart.
author: John Heywood

text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Folk wisdom

text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
author: Chinese proverb

text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: Folk wisdom

text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you have imagined.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Nothing can stop the man with the right mental attitude from achieving his goal.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

text: What we think, we become.
author: Buddha

text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
author: Buddha

text: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
author: Buddha

text: Happiness does not depend on what you have or who you are. It solely relies on what you think.
author: Buddha

text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
author: Lao Tzu

text: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Confucius

text: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.
author: Confucius

text: Real knowledge is to know the extent of one's ignorance.
author: Confucius

text: We have two ears and one mouth so that we can listen twice as much as we speak.
author: Epictetus

text: Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens.
author: Epictetus

text: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
author: Seneca

text: As is a tale, so is life: not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.
author: Seneca

text: While we are postponing, life speeds by.
author: Seneca

text: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
author: Seneca

text: This above all: to thine own self be true.
author: William Shakespeare

text: We know what we are, but know not what we may be.
author: William Shakespeare

text: All the world's a stage, and all the men and women merely players.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Listen to many, speak to a few.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Experience is simply the name we give our mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Without music, life would be a mistake.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Kindness is the language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
author: Mark Twain

text: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.
author: Mark Twain

text: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear — not absence of fear.
author: Mark Twain

text: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Our life is frittered away by detail. Simplify, simplify.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Things do not change; we change.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Well done is better than well said.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Whatever you are, be a good one.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: I am a slow walker, but I never walk back.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Aristotle

text: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: To find yourself, think for yourself.
author: Socrates

text: Fall seven times, stand up eight.
author: Japanese proverb

text: The gem cannot be polished without friction, nor man perfected without trials.
author: Chinese proverb

text: When the student is ready, the teacher will appear.
author: Buddhist proverb

text: Fortune favours the bold.
author: Virgil

text: Carpe diem. Seize the day.
author: Horace

text: Rule your mind or it will rule you.
author: Horace

text: One kind word can warm three winter months.
author: Japanese proverb

text: A clear conscience is a soft pillow.
author: German proverb

text: A house with a loving family is a home.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Small steps every day lead to big changes over time.
author: Folk wisdom

text: A warm cup in the morning can change the whole day.
author: Folk wisdom

text: The best conversations happen around the table.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Home is where the heart is.
author: Pliny the Elder

text: Cleanliness is next to godliness.
author: John Wesley

text: A place for everything, and everything in its place.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Waste not, want not.
author: English proverb

text: The best things in life are free.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Laugh and the world laughs with you; weep and you weep alone.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

text: Count your blessings.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Today is a gift. That is why it is called the present.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Every day brings a chance to start again.
author: Folk wisdom

text: A smile is the shortest distance between two people.
author: Victor Borge

text: Love begins at home.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Spread love everywhere you go.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love.
author: Folk wisdom

text: The greatest thing you'll ever learn is just to love and be loved in return.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength; loving someone deeply gives you courage.
author: Lao Tzu

text: We are most alive when we're in love.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Love is when the other person's happiness is more important than your own.
author: Folk wisdom

text: A life without love is like a year without summer.
author: Swedish proverb

text: Love is the flower you've got to let grow.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Love is the greatest refreshment in life.
author: Folk wisdom

text: The giving of love is an education in itself.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Love is the only reasonable and satisfactory answer to the problem of human existence.
author: Folk wisdom

text: To love is to receive a glimpse of heaven.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Love is the master key that opens the gates of happiness.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.

text: A day without laughter is a day wasted.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Life is better when you're laughing.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Joy is the simplest form of gratitude.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Gratitude turns what we have into enough.
author: Folk wisdom

text: The little things? The little moments? They aren't little.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Enjoy the little things, for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Happiness is not a goal; it is a by-product.
author: Folk wisdom

text: The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Do one thing every day that scares you.
author: Folk wisdom

text: It is not the length of life, but the depth of life.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Life is a succession of lessons which must be lived to be understood.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The first step in the acquisition of wisdom is silence.
author: Pythagoras

text: Silence is a true friend who never betrays.
author: Confucius

text: He who knows others is wise; he who knows himself is enlightened.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The soft overcomes the hard; the gentle overcomes the rigid.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Do not anticipate trouble, or worry about what may never happen. Keep in the sunlight.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: He that can have patience can have what he will.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Without continual growth and progress, such words as improvement and success have no meaning.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: I have learned that to be with those I like is enough.
author: Walt Whitman

text: Keep your face always toward the sunshine — and shadows will fall behind you.
author: Walt Whitman

text: Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present.
author: Folk wisdom

text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Your time is limited. Don't waste it living someone else's life.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Stay hungry. Stay foolish.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
author: Aristotle

text: Excellence is never an accident.
author: Aristotle

text: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
author: Aristotle

text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence then is not an act but a habit.
author: Aristotle

text: The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.
author: Aristotle

text: Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet.
author: Aristotle

text: The only way to achieve the impossible is to believe it is possible.
author: Folk wisdom

text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Whether you think you can or you think you can't, you're right.
author: Henry Ford

text: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas Edison

text: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.
author: Thomas Edison

text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are.
author: Folk wisdom

text: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin.
author: Lao Tzu

text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: Folk wisdom

text: You don't have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: The best revenge is massive success.
author: Frank Sinatra

text: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Try not to become a man of success. Rather become a man of value.
author: Albert Einstein

text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow.
author: Albert Einstein

text: A happy family is but an earlier heaven.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Family is not an important thing. It's everything.
author: Folk wisdom

text: The love of family is life's greatest blessing.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Rejoice in the little things that make life sweet.
author: Folk wisdom

text: A good laugh is sunshine in a house.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

text: There is no charm equal to tenderness of heart.
author: Jane Austen

text: There are no strangers here; only friends you haven't yet met.
author: William Butler Yeats

text: A friend is one of the nicest things you can have.
author: Folk wisdom

text: Friendship is the only cement that will ever hold the world together.
author: Woodrow Wilson

text: One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives.
author: Euripides

text: A single rose can be my garden; a single friend, my world.
author: Folk wisdom

text: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.
author: Henry David Thoreau
